meanings.definition: To move or slide something quickly or abruptly.
meanings.sent1: She skyfs the book onto the shelf.
meanings.sent2: He skyfs the chair across the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat skyfs the toy mouse under the couch.
meanings.sent4: The wind skyfs the leaves along the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The child skyfs the puzzle pieces into place with a quick motion.

meanings.definition: A sudden, quick movement or slide.
meanings.sent1: The skyfs of the car startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The sudden skyfs of the train made everyone hold on tight.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected skyfs of the roller coaster made them scream with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The skyfs of the sliding door echoed through the empty hallway.
meanings.sent5: The skyfs of the falling rocks created a loud noise in the canyon.

meanings.sent1: The squirrel's skyfs caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The skyfs of the mouse across the floor were barely noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The skyfs of the falling raindrops sounded like tiny drums.
meanings.sent4: The skyfs of the falling leaves added a touch of autumn to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The skyfs of the butterfly's wings created a gentle breeze in the garden.
